AssemblyTooltip:
A collection of scripts that work together through named events to do common simple scripting tasks.
Events that start with -> respond to event names by doing something.
Events that end with -> will send an event after something is done.

Scripts.Tooltip: Controls object animations in response to simple script events.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Start playing on these events. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Pause playing on these events. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Start playing Range A on these events. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The starting frame for Range A

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The ending frame for Range A

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Start playing on these events. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The starting frame for Range B

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The ending frame for Range B

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Enable responding to events for this script

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Disable responding to events for this script

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Update the region tag above by incrementing the version when updating anything in the region.
If a Group is set, will only respond and send to other SimpleScripts with the same Group tag set.
Does NOT accept CSV lists of groups.
To send or receive events to/from a specific group from outside that group prepend the group name with a > to the event name, e.g. "my_group>on"

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0

If StartEnabled is false then the script will not respond to events until an (-> Enable) event is received.

Scripts.Tooltip: Sends simple script events when collisions occur.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
The events to send when an agent bumps the object. Can be a comma separated list of event names.
For Trigger Volumes will send when the agent enters the volume.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
For Trigger Volumes the events to send when an agent exits the volume. Can be a comma separated list of event names.
Only sent if the script is on a Trigger Volume.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
The events to send when an agent punches the object. Can be a comma separated list of event names.
For Trigger Volumes will send when the agent's punch enters the volume.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
For Trigger Volumes the events to send when an agent's punch exits the volume. Can be a comma separated list of event names.
Only sent if the script is on a Trigger Volume.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Will send when the first agent enters a trigger volume.
Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Will send when the last agent exits a trigger volume.
Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
The events to send when an object bumps the object. Can be a comma separated list of event names.
For Trigger Volumes will send when the object enters the volume.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
For Trigger Volumes the events to send when an object exits the volume. Can be a comma separated list of event names.
Only sent if the script is on a Trigger Volume

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Enable responding to events for this script

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Disable responding to events for this script

Attributes.Value: Initial angular velocity, in object's local space.

Attributes.Value: Offset variance, in object's local space

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Variance on initial angular velocity, in object's local space.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Enable responding to events for this script. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Scripts.Tooltip: Put this script on an object that is to be picked up and used like a gun or pointer, to send events to other scripts when specific game-like actions happen. The object should have grab points defined with Stays in Hand set to true. For a target game use the Game.Target script on the objects to be hit.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent whenever the trigger is pulled and there is ammo.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when a shot hits another avatar.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when a shot hits anything recognizable target, either a player or an object with the Game.Target script on it.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when a shot does not hit either a player or an object with the Game.Target script on it.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when the trigger is pulled but there is no ammo.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when the gun is reloaded.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The input method to fire. Default: 'Trigger' corresponds to left mouse button and VR triggers.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The input method to reload, if reload is enabled. Default: 'SecondaryAction' corresponds to R on keyboard, X and A on Oculus Touch and bottom-of-touchpad click on Vive Wands.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The amount of time in seconds that it takes to reload before firing can happen again.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If true a score and hit accuracy will be said on chat when the object is dropped.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Points earned any time a player is hit. Points per target are set individually in the Target script.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Number of shots fired before a reload is required. Set to 0 for unlimited.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If true the gun will work in VR.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If true the gun will only work in desktop mouse look mode. Press Escape to enter or exit mouse look mode.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
If true the gun will work with normal mouse clicks, outside of mouse look mode.
Note that this mode can make aiming games trivial.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If true the gun will work while the user is in 'Free Cam' mode.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Update the region tag above by incrementing the version when updating anything in the region.
If a Group is set, will only respond and send to other SimpleScripts with the same Group tag set.
Does NOT accept CSV lists of groups.
To send or receive events to/from a specific group from outside that group prepend the group name with a > to the event name, e.g. "my_group>on"

Scripts.Tooltip: Use with the Selector or Game.Gun scripts to create targets that will respond to being shot or selected.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: This event will act as though the shooter did the action. For example, a Teleport script listening for this event would teleport the user that selected or shot this target.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Number of points earned for hitting this target.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Update the region tag above by incrementing the version when updating anything in the region.
If a Group is set, will only respond and send to other SimpleScripts with the same Group tag set.
Does NOT accept CSV lists of groups.
To send or receive events to/from a specific group from outside that group prepend the group name with a > to the event name, e.g. "my_group>on"

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Set the object to be grabbable on these events. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Set the object to be NOT grabbable on these events. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

To send or receive events to/from a specific group from outside that group prepend the group name with a > to the event name, e.g. "my_group>on"

Scripts.Tooltip: Sends simple script events on keyboard and controller button presses.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
The commands to listen for to send "On Command 1 ->" events. See CommandData documentation for the list of available commands.
A comma separated list of commands can be used to designate a key combo: all keys listed must be pressed at the same time to trigger the events.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The events to send when the key or key combo from Command 1 is pressed.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
The commands to listen for to send "On Command 2 ->" events.  See CommandData documentation for the list of available commands.
A comma separated list of commands can be used to designate a key combo: all keys listed must be pressed at the same time to trigger the events.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The events to send when the key or key combo from Command 2 is pressed.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
The commands to listen for to send "On Command 3 ->" events.  See CommandData documentation for the list of available commands.
A comma separated list of commands can be used to designate a key combo: all keys listed must be pressed at the same time to trigger the events.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The events to send when the key or key combo from Command 3 is pressed.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If Owner Restricted is set to true, then the commands in this script only respond to key-presses by the scene owner.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Disable responding to commands for this script

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Disable responding to commands for this script

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
If StartEnabled is true then the script will respond to commands when the scene is loaded
If StartEnabled is false then the script will not respond to commands until an (-> Enable) event is received.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Update the region tag above by incrementing the version when updating anything in the region.
If a Group is set, will only respond and send to other SimpleScripts with the same Group tag set.
Does NOT accept CSV lists of groups.
To send or receive events to/from a specific group from outside that group prepend the group name with a > to the event name, e.g. "my_group>on"

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0

The events sent will cycle through only the On Click events with values set.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
The events to send on the second click of this object. Can be a comma separated list of event names.
The events sent will cycle through only the On Click events with values set.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
The events to send on the third click of this object. Can be a comma separated list of event names.
The events sent will cycle through only the On Click events with values set.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
The events to send on the fourth click of this object. Can be a comma separated list of event names.
The events sent will cycle through only the On Click events with values set.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Maximum number of events per second that will trigger events. Set to 0 for no limit.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Reset this script so the next click will be 1st click.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Enable responding to events for this script

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Disable responding to events for this script

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:

Scripts.Tooltip: Moves the object in response to simple script events.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Start moving on these events. Can be a comma separated list of event names.
Will be ignored if the move motion is already in progress.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:

Will be ignored if the reset motion is already in progress.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Offset from base position, in objects local space

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The pivot point of the rotation, in objects local space.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The time taken to move from the base position to the offset position. The same time is used for the return motion.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when the move motion begins. Use to trigger SFX etc.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when the move motion begins. Use to trigger SFX etc.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If > 0, motion will be smoothed so that it starts and ends slowly. The total duration will still be the same.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: if true, start in the moved position.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Update the region tag above by incrementing the version when updating anything in the region.
If a Group is set, will only respond and send to other SimpleScripts with the same Group tag set.

Scripts.Tooltip: Put this script on an object to create a selector that will send events after being picked up when the 'Select Command' is used to select users, objects, or targets.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The input method to select something. Default: 'Trigger' corresponds to left mouse button and VR triggers.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when another avatar is selected. These events are sent as if the avatar selected performed the action! A Teleport script listening for this event would teleport the person selected.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when an object with the Simple Script Library script 'Game.Target' is selected. These events are sent as if the object selected performed the action. A Teleport script listening for this event will do nothing.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If true then the 'Target Selected ->' event and the Target's 'Target Hit ->' event will only be sent if the target is in the same group as the selector. If the Target is in a different group then 'Object Selected ->' events are sent.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when an object without the Target script is selected. These events are sent as if the object selected performed the action! A Teleport script listening for this event would do nothing.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Event sent when a shot hits nothing - no players or objects of any kind.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: This event happens every time the 'Select Command' is used, whether anything is hit or not. These events are sent as the user of the selector object performing the action. A Teleport script listening for this event would teleport the user holding the selector object.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If true the selector object will work in VR.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If true the selector will only work in desktop mouse look mode. Press Escape to enter or exit mouse look mode.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
If true the selector will work with normal mouse clicks, outside of mouse look mode.
Note that this mode can make some aiming games trivial.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If true the selector will work while the user is in 'Free Cam' mode.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Update the region tag above by incrementing the version when updating anything in the region.
If a Group is set, will only respond and send to other SimpleScripts with the same Group tag set.
Does NOT accept CSV lists of groups.
To send or receive events to/from a specific group from outside that group prepend the group name with a > to the event name, e.g. "my_group>on"

Scripts.Tooltip: Plays a sound in response to simple script events.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
If false the sound will play at the same loudness for everyone.
If true and the object has an AudioComponent then the sound will come from the audio component, and follow the object if it moves.
If true and the object does not have an AudioComponent then the sound will play from the position of the object at the time the event is received and will not move.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If not zero the pitch will be shifted on each play by a random amount between -PitchVariance and +PitchVariance, in semitones.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If not zero the loudness will be shifted on each play by a random amount between -LoudnessVariance and +LoudnessVariance.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Play the sound. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The minimum loudness the sound will be played at. If less than Maximum Loudness the sound will play each time at a randomly chosen loudness between the two.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Playback pitch will be shifted by this number of semitones.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Alternate way to playback the sound. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Alternate playback pitch will be shifted by this number of semitones.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Stop the currently playing sound. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Auto-play this looping sound when the script is enabled.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Enable responding to events for this script. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Disable responding to events for this script. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
If StartEnabled is true then the script will respond to events when the scene is loaded
If StartEnabled is false then the script will not respond to events until an (-> Enable) event is received.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Update the region tag above by incrementing the version when updating anything in the region.
If a Group is set, will only respond and send to other SimpleScripts with the same Group tag set.
Does NOT accept CSV lists of groups.
To send or receive events to/from a specific group from outside that group prepend the group name with a > to the event name, e.g. "my_group>on"

Scripts.Tooltip: Teleports a player in response to simple script events.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Teleport the person who interacted to somewhere within the scene. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The teleport destination within the scene.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
If true the destination position is relative to the object this script is on
If false the destination is in scene coordinates regardless of this script's object's position.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Teleport the person that interacted to a remote scene. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The destination scene owner (from the scene url).

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The destination scene handle (from the scene url).

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Enable responding to events for this script. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Disable responding to events for this script. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
If StartEnabled is true then the script will respond to events when the scene is loaded
If StartEnabled is false then the script will not respond to events until an (-> Enable) event is received.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Update the region tag above by incrementing the version when updating anything in the region.
If a Group is set, will only respond and send to other SimpleScripts with the same Group tag set.
Does NOT accept CSV lists of groups.
To send or receive events to/from a specific group from outside that group prepend the group name with a > to the event name, e.g. "my_group>on"

Scripts.Tooltip: Sends simple script events on a timer.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The delay until the timer event, in Seconds

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The interval of events, in Seconds between events

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: If true the timer will repeat every Interval seconds. If false the timer will fire only once, after Delay seconds.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The events to send at the timer interval, alternating with "On Timer 2nd ->" if both are specified. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The events to send at the timer interval, alternating with "On Timer 1st ->" if both are specified. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Start this timer on these events. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Stop this timer on these events. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
If StartEnabled is true then the script will respond to events when the scene is loaded
If StartEnabled is false then the script will not respond to events until an (-> Enable) event is received.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Update the region tag above by incrementing the version when updating anything in the region.
If a Group is set, will only respond and send to other SimpleScripts with the same Group tag set.
Does NOT accept CSV lists of groups.
To send or receive events to/from a specific group from outside that group prepend the group name with a > to the event name, e.g. "my_group>on"

Scripts.Tooltip: Sends simple script events when players enter or leave the scene.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The events to send when a user visits the scene. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: The events to send when a user leaves the scene. Can be a comma separated list of event names.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Enable responding to events for this script

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value: Disable responding to events for this script

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
If StartEnabled is true then the script will respond to events when the scene is loaded
If StartEnabled is false then the script will not respond to events until an (-> Enable) event is received.

Attributes.Name: Tooltip.0
Attributes.Value:
Update the region tag above by incrementing the version when updating anything in the region.
If a Group is set, will only respond and send to other SimpleScripts with the same Group tag set.
Does NOT accept CSV lists of groups.
To send or receive events to/from a specific group from outside that group prepend the group name with a > to the event name, e.g. "my_group>on"
